message.subject: Lock your office door and stay away from the windows…
message.text:
Wednesday October 22nd was set to be a typically busy day in the House. >From my first meetings in Centre Block on Parliament Hill starting at 7 AM to heading to my Confederation Building office for staff meetings, reviewing our amendments to try to stop the legislation to dismantle harm reduction sites (like In-Site), improve legislation aimed at increasing hiring of veterans, and then on to meeting with the other MPs who fall into the category of representing small parties or independents. At 2 pm sharp I had been prepared to make a statement in the House honouring the Dalai Lama, whom I will be seeing on Friday in Vancouver, and calling for China to respect human rights in Tibet. By 4 pm I was to be testifying in the Senate committee studying my private members bill for a National Lyme Disease strategy. At 6:30 PM I was to be debating climate policy with the Parliamentary Secretary for the environment. The evening was a series of meetings including with former Parliamentarians at their annual meeting.
Well, that was what was supposed to happen.
Instead it has been a day of tragedies and shock. As I write this, I am still in lock-down. With seven of my staff in Confederation Building, our office door is locked and we are staying away from the windows. The security officers are still monitoring our hallways. We were told eight hours ago to lock the office door and stay away from the windows.
It doesn't feel real and I wish it were not. Right now I feel we have more questions than answers.
What we do know is that a member of our Armed Forces has been killed at the War Memorial located a stone's throw from Parliament Hill. We also know that the Sergeant at Arms, my friend Kevin Vickers, was responsible for shooting and killing the armed man inside Centre Block. There are reports of a second shooter, but that remains unconfirmed.
On Monday a soldier was killed in a small community in Quebec, Saint-Jean-sur-Richelieu south of Montreal. Martin Rouleau, the driver of the car, had deliberately taken aim at members of our armed forces who were off duty in a shopping centre parking lot. He was killed shortly afterward by police. Rouleau was known to the police because his parents became alarmed about his erratic behaviour and sudden conversion to radical beliefs. The description of his circumstances suggest mental health issues may have played a role. We know nothing right now about the assailant (or assailants) in Ottawa today.
So, while it is too early to jump to conclusions, I intend to hold fast to the following: we must ensure that this appalling act of violence is not used to justify a disproportionate response. We must not resort to hyperbolic rhetoric. We need to determine if these actions are coordinated to any larger group or are the actions of one or two deranged individuals. If it is the latter we must develop tools and a systematic approach to dissuade our youth from being attracted to violent extremist groups of any kind. We need to protect our rights and liberties in a democracy.
We do know that through history these kinds of events open the door to a loss of democracy. Naomi Klein details the elements of seizing the opportunity created by tragedy or tumult in _Shock Doctrine_. The title of her new and important book on climate, _This Changes Everything_, is correct - the threat of the climate crisis changes everything. The shootings on Parliament Hill do not change everything. It is up to all of us to ensure that, to the extent we encounter demands for change, we keep in the forefront of our minds that once we surrender any rights it is very difficult to restore them. Let's demand answers, sensible policies and proportionate responses.
Elizabeth
[1] [2]
Elizabeth May, O.C. MP, Saanich-Gulf Islands Leader, Green Party of Canada
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

message.subject: right to the point:
message.text:
Friend --
I'll get right to the point.
As you may have heard, the 20th Conference of the Parties (COP20) of the UN Framework Convention on Climate Change will take place in Lima, Peru this December.
Of course, the Harper Conservatives will be there, trying their best to sabotage the negotiations and help out their well-connected friends in the fossil fuel industry.
BUT DID YOU KNOW IT’S BEEN 3 YEARS SINCE EITHER THE LIBERALS OR THE NDP SENT AN MP TO THE NEGOTIATIONS?
Climate change is just not a priority for them.
, WE NEED LEADERS AT COP20.
And that's why Elizabeth May is going to Peru: to bring your voice to the global negotiations.
Elizabeth will be Canada's only representative for real action on the climate crisis.
STAND WITH ELIZABETH TODAY -- ADD YOUR NAME TO THE MAJORITY OF CANADIANS WHO WANT CLIMATE ACTION NOW. [1]
Next year, at the 2015 COP in Paris, we face the deadline for a global treaty to replace the Kyoto Protocol.
And this year we need to lay the groundwork for that treaty -- we need to show the world that Canada is ready to lead once again.
WE WANT TO SHOW JUST HOW MANY CANADIANS ARE DEMANDING CLIMATE ACTION FROM THEIR GOVERNMENT -- ADD YOUR NAME NOW:
WWW.GREENPARTY.CA/CANADIANS-WANT-CLIMATE-ACTION [1]
This will be a tough fight, and it's going to take all of us who care about combating the climate crisis working together to make sure that we come out on top.
Thank you for being a part of this ,
Emily
Emily McMillan Executive Director Green Party of Canada
[2] [3]

message.subject: not surprising, but very cool:
message.text:
Friend --
If you've ever had the chance to hear Elizabeth May speak in person then this news won't surprise you --
ELIZABETH HAS BEEN NAMED 2014’S BEST ORATOR IN THE MACLEAN’S PARLIAMENTARIAN OF THE YEAR AWARDS.
This is the third year in a row that Elizabeth has been honoured. As voted on by her peers in the House she has been named:
-- 2012: Parliamentarian of Year -- 2013: Canada's Hardest Working MP -- 2014: Best Orator
IF YOU ASK ME, ELIZABETH IS EACH OF THESE EVERY YEAR -- SHE HAS MADE US SO PROUD AS CANADA’S FIRST ELECTED GREEN MP.
RIGHT NOW WE ARE WORKING NIGHT AND DAY TO GET READY TO ELECT MORE GREEN MPS TO JOIN ELIZABETH IN OTTAWA -- DONATE $ NOW AND BE A PART OF IT. [1]
Friend, Canada is at a crossroads and the 2015 election will determine which path we take.
On one path we continue to become an extraction economy based on expanding the oil sands and building pipelines. We continue to have our democracy eroded by hyper-partisan leaders who sacrifice your voice for their short-term gain. We continue down the path set by the Stephen Harper Conservatives.
The other path -- our path -- has us shift our focus towards a better future. We invest in a sustainable economy based on the transition to cleaner and greener energy while focusing on value-added production. We move towards a true democracy where MPs represent their constituents in government and not the government to their constituents. We head down the path advocated by Elizabeth May and the Green Party.
DONATE $ TODAY -- MAKE SURE WE ELECT MORE GREEN MPS AND HEAD DOWN THE RIGHT PATH TO A BETTER CANADA. [1]
Thanks! Emily
[1]
Emily McMillan Executive Director Green Party of Canada

message.subject: this is exciting...
message.text:
Dear Friend,
Today, I am thrilled to share some exciting news. The Green Party is welcoming a second Deputy Leader to the team!
DANIEL GREEN IS A PIONEER IN ENVIRONMENTAL RESEARCH AND ACTIVISM. HE HAS BEEN A LEADER IN THE MOVEMENT TO PROTECT OUR LAND AND WATER FOR MORE THAN 30 YEARS.
I have known Daniel for decades -- through his time at the helm of the Société pour Vaincre la Pollution in his home province of Quebec and his work as a scientific advisor to organizations like the Sierra Club of Canada.
Daniel understands that all citizens have the right to breathe clean air and drink unpolluted water and he has devoted his life to defending these rights.
He has made a profound difference on the issue of environmental contamination -- successfully taking legal actions before the Supreme Court of Canada. Daniel was instrumental in causing the corporations involved in the tragedy at Lac-Mégantic to decontaminate the site in 2013 and 2014.
I am deeply grateful to Daniel for his commitment to Green values. He will join Bruce Hyer as our second Deputy Leader.
TAKE A MOMENT NOW TO JOIN BRUCE AND I IN WELCOMING DANIEL TO THE GREEN PARTY:
WWW.GREENPARTY.CA/WELCOME-DANIEL [1]
Friend, with incredible team members like Daniel being recruited across the country, I know we are headed for a breakthrough in next year's election.
Thanks for being with us during this exciting time,
Elizabeth
ELIZABETH MAY, O.C. MP, SAANICH-GULF ISLANDS LEADER, GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
[2] [3]

message.subject: It’s time to act
message.text:
Hi Friend,
Did you hear the news?
On Tuesday, I had the honour of being named Deputy Leader of the Green Party of Canada by Elizabeth May.
I have been overwhelmed by the warm welcome and can't wait to start advocating on behalf of the Green Party. As a lifelong environmentalist, I know that there's never been a more critical time for the Green voice to be heard loud and clear.
WE HAVE ALREADY BEGUN TO SEE THE ALARMING IMPACTS OF CLIMATE CHANGE. TIME IS RUNNING OUT -- AND GLOBAL ACTION IS NEEDED NOW IF WE WANT TO AVERT THE CLIMATE CRISIS.
Today, Elizabeth May arrives in Lima, Peru, for a very important event -- the 20th Annual Conference of Parties (COP20) of the UN Framework Convention on Climate Change.
She'll be joining delegates from around the world to take action to lower greenhouse gas emissions.
ADD YOUR NAME TODAY AND SEND A CLEAR MESSAGE TO OUR GOVERNMENT -- IT’S TIME TO ACT:
WWW.GREENPARTY.CA/CANADIANS-WANT-CLIMATE-ACTION [1]
Thank you, Friend. I look forward to getting to know you better. The Green momentum is growing -- I can feel it!
Daniel
[1]
DANIEL GREEN DEPUTY LEADER GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
[2] [3]
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

message.subject: my letter to you :
message.text:
Dear Friend,
As we come to the close of 2014, we are on the verge of the most critical election in Canadian history. I know all political fundraising appeals make dramatic claims that you have to give more, now more than ever. And I know that the sentence I just wrote might look like hyperbole -- but it's not.
Canada has had many elections where the choices were stark. The Free Trade election of 1988. The dismal election of 2005-2006 that gave Stephen Harper's Conservatives their first minority.
This election is critical not only due to our domestic pressures and challenges. This election is critical because we are running out of time for climate action.
Anyone who pays attention to the climate issue knows that the window of opportunity to avoid runaway global warming is closing -- rapidly. Avoiding levels of greenhouse gas concentrations in the atmosphere that risk pushing the whole system into self-accelerating, unstoppable warming will take dramatic reductions -- in all countries -- at the same time.
Some are concluding this is impossible -- but I have hope.
In my new book, "Who We Are: Reflections on My Life and Canada" I grappled with the threat of defeatism:
"Telling me it is impossible to avoid runaway global warming does not make me believe it is inevitable that humanity will fail to rise to the challenge. We will, because we must.
"Being hopeful is not the same thing as being unrealistic. This is not the dewy eyed dreamy hope of the deluded. In the context of the climate crisis, hope is hard work. As David Orr, environmental studies professor at Oberlin College, put it, "Hope is a verb with its sleeves rolled up."
"This is where I ask you to have hope. And work to make it viable."
HOPE:
Here is why you should have hope. And this is why the 2015 election is the most important in our history.
READ MORE >> [1]
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

message.subject: this is urgent:
message.text:
Friend --
I’LL BE FRANK -- HOW MUCH WE CAN FUNDRAISE IN THE NEXT FOUR DAYS WILL DIRECTLY IMPACT HOW MANY MPS WE ELECT IN THE COMING ELECTION.
For the past three and a half years, Elizabeth May has represented our vision in Ottawa, and I think it's safe to say we can be proud of the job she's done.
For the past year, Bruce Hyer has been backing Elizabeth up in Parliament and I've seen first hand how great an impact another Green MP has had.
Now it's my job to make sure we send more MPs to join Elizabeth and Bruce in Ottawa -- but I need your help today.
DONATE $ NOW -- MAKE SURE WE HAVE THE RESOURCES WE NEED TO BE SUCCESSFUL IN THE 2015 ELECTION. [1]
Friend, right now the other parties are raising millions of dollars that will be spent on negative advertising.
We will never spend a cent on negative advertising.
Your donation today will be spent on a positive message -- to empower Canadians like you and I to go out and spread our vision for a better Canada.
PLEASE, MAKE A DONATION TODAY AND LET’S GET STARTED:
WWW.GREENPARTY.CA/DONATE-FOR-A-BETTER-CANADA [1]
Thanks for all you do,
Paul
[1]
PAUL NOBLE DEPUTY NATIONAL CAMPAIGN MANAGER GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
P.S. If you'd like to make a donation by phone, PLEASE CALL TOLL-FREE 1-866-868-3447. We'll be answering phones from 9 AM ET - 9 PM ET, EVERY DAY UNTIL JANUARY 1. If you don't get through right away, please call again.

message.subject: where we’re at:
message.text:
Hi Friend --
I'm the numbers guy here at the GPC and I can tell you that every time I refresh my screen I see more and more Canadians donating for a better Canada.
In order to succeed in the 2015 election, we have set a crucial end-of-year fundraising goal of $250,000.
THE DEADLINE IS DEC. 31 -- THE LAST DAY TO DONATE AND GET A TAX RECEIPT FOR 2014.
DONATE $ RIGHT NOW AND HELP US ACHIEVE OUR GOAL. [1]
Remember that due to generous tax credits, your contribution of $5 today will cost you as little as $1.25.
CAN WE COUNT ON YOU TO GET YOUR DONATION IN AHEAD OF THE DEADLINE?
WWW.GREENPARTY.CA/DONATE-FOR-A-BETTER-CANADA [1]
Thanks! Kyle
[1]
KYLE TATE DIGITAL DIRECTOR GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
P.S. If you'd like to make a donation by phone, please CALL TOLL-FREE 1-866-868-3447. We'll be answering phones from 9 AM ET - 9 PM ET, EVERY DAY UNTIL JANUARY 1. If you don't get through right away, please call again.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

from.name: Emily McMillan, Green Party of Canada

message.subject: why we do this
message.text:
Friend --
You've seen a lot of email from us over the past few days.
BUT IT’S THIS SIMPLE -- WE ARE GOING TO WIN SEATS IN 2015.
HOW MANY WILL DEPEND ON YOUR DONATION OF $ TODAY. [1]
We have an uphill battle ahead of us -- the other three parties are raising millions of dollars more than we are.
We need you to help deliver our positive message to Canadians -- your donation will go directly towards that goal.
DONATE $ BEFORE THE DECEMBER 31 DEADLINE -- HELP US BUILD THE STRONGEST ELECTION CAMPAIGN IN GREEN PARTY HISTORY. [1]
WE’VE ALREADY RAISED AN AMAZING $108,000 -- WILL YOU MAKE A CONTRIBUTION TODAY TO HELP US MEET OUR GOAL OF $250,000?
WWW.GREENPARTY.CA/DONATE-FOR-A-BETTER-CANADA [1]
Thank you!
Emily
[1]
EMILY MCMILLAN EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
P.S. If you'd like to make a donation by phone, please CALL TOLL-FREE 1-866-868-3447. We'll be answering phones from 9 AM ET - 9 PM ET. If you don't get through right away, please call again.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

message.subject: grateful for your support
message.text:
Hi Friend,
Did you see yesterday's note from Emily?
I just got off the phone with our fundraising department and they told me we have raised nearly $115,000 since her email yesterday!
It is crucial we make our fundraising target of $250,000 by tonight at midnight.
Can I count on you?
WWW.GREENPARTY.CA/DONATE-FOR-A-BETTER-CANADA [1]
Wishing you the very best for a Green 2015!
Elizabeth
Elizabeth May Leader Green Party of Canada
PS. To make a donation on the phone you can call 1-866-868-3447
Green Party of Canada PO Box 997, STN B, Ottawa ON, K1P 5R1 1.866.868.3447

from.name: Emily McMillan, Green Party of Canada

message.subject: it’s not about the croissants:
message.text:
Friend --
Picture this:
It's December 2015 in Paris. World governments are coming together to negotiate a new global climate treaty - one with the goal of action from every country to avoid catastrophic levels of global warming.
What kind of Canada do you want at these talks?
OPTION 1 -- A Canada with a strong Green presence in parliament. A Canada that will show leadership in forging a treaty to protect our kids' future.
or
OPTION 2 -- A Canada at the 2015 negotiations only marginally better than in 2014. A Canada content with weak treaties and non-binding targets.
OPTION 3 -- The Canada we have now. A Canada in the grip of a prime minister who has ignored the climate crisis at every turn to barrel ahead with his pro-pipeline agenda.
THIS YEAR WE GET TO VOTE FOR OPTION 1.
The 2015 election is less than a year away -- electing a strong team of Green MPs is the only way to ensure that Canada will be a leader at the Paris negotiations.
Stephen Harper has done everything in his power to sabotage climate action. >From the gutting of environmental laws, to the muzzling of scientists, to the expansion of the oil sands -- the message is clear: another term of the Harper Conservatives will be devastating. We will not let that happen.
But even a minority parliament led by Tom Mulcair or Justin Trudeau will not be good enough. Neither of the larger opposition parties has demonstrated an understanding of the urgency of the climate emergency.
ADD YOUR NAME TODAY TO STAND WITH THE GREEN PARTY AND ENSURE THAT CANADA BECOMES A WORLD LEADER IN TAKING CLIMATE ACTION. [1]
Friend, we are running out of time to reduce global emissions -- Canada has been sabotaging global action for too long.
WE NEED A MEANINGFUL PLAN TO CUT CARBON POLLUTION -- ADD YOUR NAME TODAY TO SHOW YOUR SUPPORT. [1]
IT’S NOW OR NEVER , AND TOGETHER WE CAN MAKE DIFFERENCE:
WWW.GREENPARTY.CA/WE-CAN-MAKE-A-DIFFERENCE [1]
Thanks!
Emily
Emily McMillan Executive Director Green Party of Canada
[2] [3]
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

from.name: Bruce Hyer, Green Party of Canada

message.subject: this is about our rights and freedoms
message.text:
Friend --
Did you see this in the Toronto Star?
“SO FAR, THE ONLY OPPOSITION MP WITH ENOUGH GUTS TO CRITIQUE THE CONTENT OF THE CONSERVATIVE GOVERNMENT’S NEW ANTI-TERROR BILL IS GREEN PARTY LEADER ELIZABETH MAY.”
Last week, Stephen Harper introduced a new anti-terrorism bill that is invasive, overreaching and dangerously vague.
This new legislation risks turning the Canadian Security Intelligence Service into a "secret police force" without the proper oversight or accountability.
The Liberals and the NDP have chosen to play it safe -- afraid that if they stand up for the Charter of Rights and Freedoms they will be attacked as "soft on terrorism".
STAND WITH ELIZABETH MAY TODAY -- ADD YOUR VOICE AND TELL THE GOVERNMENT AND OPPOSITION THAT OUR CIVIL LIBERTIES ARE MORE IMPORTANT THAN PARTISAN POLITICS. [1]
Green Party MPs will continue to be your voice in the House of Commons, defending your civil liberties as a top priority.
-- TELL YOUR MP THAT SACRIFICING INDIVIDUAL RIGHTS AND FREEDOMS IS NOT THE SOLUTION TO THE THREAT OF TERRORISM.
Add your name here: GREENPARTY.CA/DEFEND-OUR-RIGHTS-AND-FREEDOMS [1]
Thank you,
Bruce
[1]
BRUCE HYER MP, DEPUTY LEADER GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
[2] [3]
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

message.subject: what's your first memory?
message.text:
Friend,
WHAT’S YOUR FIRST MEMORY OF THE CBC?
Mine is listening with my father to the wonderful Max Ferguson on CBC Radio.
My father would proudly tell me that Max lived in the Maritimes, just like we did, and that people all over Canada listened to his show. It made a big impression on me, as a little girl growing up in a small town, that my Dad seemed to know the "man on the radio" even though they had never met.
It was memories like these that led me into a career in public broadcasting.
It was also memories like these that led me to recently leave my job as the host of CBC's All Points West to run for the Green Party.
I wanted to speak out about the future of the CBC -- of the damage that will be done if we don't address funding cuts and independence from government.
PUBLIC BROADCASTERS LIKE THE CBC ENRICH OUR LIVES BECAUSE THEY COVER THE UNIQUE, THE UNCONVENTIONAL, THE TRULY CANADIAN.
ADD YOUR NAME NOW TO SUPPORT OUR PLAN TO SAVE THE CBC. [1]
Friend, the CBC is part of our national identity. When we cross paths with our fellow Canadians, why do we immediately feel a bond? It is our shared ideals, our shared institutions -- it is Hockey Night in Canada on a Saturday evening, or the Vinyl Cafe on a lazy Sunday.
ACROSS THIS GREAT NATION, OUR PUBLIC BROADCASTER CONNECTS US -- FROM COAST TO COAST TO COAST, IT IS CANADA’S NATIONAL VOICE.
Stand with the Green Party today and show your support for one of our greatest cultural assets -- the CBC.
HERE’S THE LINK: GREENPARTY.CA/WE-LOVE-CBC [1]
Thanks for your support,
Jo-Ann
[1]
JO-ANN ROBERTS CANDIDATE FOR VICTORIA GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
[2] [3]
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

message.subject: yes or no?
message.text:
Friend --
Yes or no? It's a simple question.
Do you want to see Elizabeth May in the leaders' debate in 2015?
You and I both know what our answer is -- Elizabeth May's presence in the debate is crucial for Canadian democracy.
But when Thomas Mulcair, Justin Trudeau, and Stephen Harper were asked that question last week, they all refused to give a direct answer.
WITH THE ELECTION ONLY MONTHS AWAY, WE THOUGHT WE WOULD ASK THEM AGAIN -- YES OR NO?
ADD YOUR NAME TODAY TO THE TENS OF THOUSANDS OF CANADIANS LIKE YOU, WHO HAVE ASKED MR. TRUDEAU, MR. MULCAIR, AND MR. HARPER TO TELL US THEIR POSITION ONCE AND FOR ALL. [1]
WE NEED 50 000 SIGNATURES IN THE NEXT WEEK TO PUSH THE OTHER THREE LEADERS TO FINALLY GIVE A STRAIGHT ANSWER.
ASK THEM TO STAND UP FOR DEMOCRACY TODAY. [1]
Here's the link: GREENPARTY.CA/STAND-UP-FOR-DEMOCRACY
[1]
Thanks,
Paul
[1]
PAUL NOBLE DEPUTY NATIONAL CAMPAIGN MANAGER GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
[2] [3]
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

message.subject: some history:
message.text:
Friend --
Here's the thing, we have until midnight on Tuesday, March 31, to make Green Party history with our strongest first quarter ever.
TO DO THAT WE NEED TO RAISE $140 000 BY THE DEADLINE.
The 2015 federal election is right around the corner and we have never seen such strong fundraising results. But if we want to really compete on the national stage in 2015, we need to keep pushing.
THIS DEADLINE IS CRITICAL.
An election could be called at any moment in the next six months and the Harper Conservatives will not hesitate to break their own fixed-date election law if they feel an early vote will benefit their chances.
THAT IS WHY I AM ASKING YOU TO DONATE $ TODAY ( AFTER THE TAX CREDIT). [1]
With your support we can ensure our candidates have the resources they need when the election is called.
If we make this a record-breaking quarter, I have no doubt we will see a record-breaking election result in 2015.
NOW IS THE TIME -- WE HAVE LESS THAN ONE WEEK TO MAKE HISTORY -- DONATE TODAY. [1]
Kyle
[1]
Kyle Tate Digital Director Green Party of Canada
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

message.subject: election call
message.text:
Friend --
THE 2015 ELECTION COULD BE CALLED ANYTIME IN THE NEXT SIX MONTHS.
As the Deputy National Campaign Manager for the Green Party of Canada, it is my job to make sure our candidates are properly equipped and ready to win -- regardless of when the election is called.
IT’S CRUNCH TIME.
Five days from now the first quarter will be over, and I will be sitting down with the national campaign committee to set our strategy for the next few months.
My ability to make the 2015 election a success depends on the budget I am able to present at this critical meeting.
THAT’S WHY IT IS SO IMPORTANT YOU DONATE BEFORE MIDNIGHT TUESDAY, MARCH 31.
By donating $5 today, you will allow me to direct resources right now to the ridings where we will be competitive in 2015. For example a donation of:
* $7 WILL HELP US PRINT LEAFLETS FOR AN ENTIRE NEIGHBORHOOD [1]
* $25 WILL ALLOW US TO PROVIDE TRAINING TO A VOLUNTEER CANVASSING TEAM
[2]
* $50 WILL HELP US INSTALL AN ENTIRE PHONE BANK IN A LOCAL CAMPAIGN OFFICE. [3]
* $100 WILL BUY AN ADVERTISEMENT ON LOCAL RADIO IN ONE OF OUR TARGET RIDINGS [4]
MAKE A DONATION OF $ ( AFTER THE TAX CREDIT) TODAY, OR CHOOSE A PROJECT ABOVE THAT YOU WOULD LIKE TO FUND DIRECTLY. [5]
We have a winning platform and a winning strategy -- donate today and help us convert that into success in 2015.
Thanks,
Paul
[5]
Paul Noble Deputy National Campaign Manager Green Party of Canada
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

from.name: Emily McMillan, Green Party of Canada

message.subject: this is why Green MPs are important
message.text:
Friend --
FIRST QUARTER FUNDRAISING DEADLINE: 11:59 PM, TUESDAY, MARCH 31
Here is why it is so important that you make a donation before the deadline -- it will help us elect more Green MPs in 2015.
More Green MPs like Elizabeth May, who was the first Member of Parliament to stand against the Harper Conservatives so-called "anti-terror bill" -- the first MP to argue this bill harms freedom of speech while doing nothing to improve national security.
It was the principled stand of Elizabeth May that led to a surge of opposition to this dangerous and invasive legislation, and spurred an important national discussion about security, oversight, and individual freedoms.
DONATE $ TODAY TO ENSURE WE HAVE THE RESOURCES WE NEED TO SEND MORE HONEST AND HARDWORKING MPS LIKE ELIZABETH TO OTTAWA IN 2015. [1]
[1] BE PART OF THE CHANGE YOU WANT TO SEE IN CANADA -- DONATE TODAY.
WWW.GREENPARTY.CA/REAL-CHANGE [1]
Thanks,
Emily
Emily McMillan Executive Director Green Party of Canada
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

from.name: Craig Cantin, Green Party of Canada

message.subject: someone from your riding
message.text:
Friend --
In three days, we hit our first critical fundraising deadline of 2015.
I can't stress this enough -- we need to reach our first quarter fundraising goal of $600,000 -- right now we are $55,000 short of that goal.
By reaching our first quarter goal, we will ensure we are ready to go regardless of when the election is called.
Here's the election year supporter record we have for this exact email address:*
SUPPORTER EMAIL: greennod@mikesmit.com
ELECTION YEAR DONOR: Pending
DONATION NEEDED FROM: your riding
SUGGESTED ACTION TODAY: MAKE YOUR FIRST DONATION OF 2015 AHEAD OF TUESDAY’S MIDNIGHT DEADLINE [1]
DONATE $ TODAY AND HELP US RAISE THE FINAL $55,000 BY MIDNIGHT ON TUESDAY, MARCH 31. [1]
The election could be called any time in the next six months.
THIS DEADLINE IS CRITICAL -- HELP ENSURE WE ARE READY:
WWW.GREENPARTY.CA/CRITICAL-DEADLINE [1]
Thanks,
Craig
[1]
CRAIG CANTIN DEPUTY EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR Green Party of Canada
*If you've made a donation online or by cheque recently that isn't reflected above, don't worry -- we are working on processing all recent donations. Thanks for your support.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

message.subject: in 48 hours:
message.text:
Friend,
With less than 48 hours until our first fundraising deadline of 2015, I wanted to send you a quick note to let you know how we are doing.
Thanks to the amazing generosity of supporters like you, we have already raised $85,000 this week, meaning we only need to raise $55,000 more to hit our first quarter target.
This deadline is critical -- the election could be called at any point in the next six months.
Our campaign readiness team is hard at work, hitting the ground running in target ridings from Victoria to Fredericton.
Donate today to ensure we set a Green Party fundraising record, and help lay the groundwork for unprecedented success in the 2015 election.
PLEASE DONATE $ TODAY -- WE ONLY HAVE 36 HOURS LEFT BEFORE THE DEADLINE. [1]
Thanks,
Elizabeth
Elizabeth May Leader Green Party of Canada
Green Party of Canada PO Box 997, STN B, Ottawa ON, K1P 5R1 1.866.868.3447

message.subject: deadline tonight
message.text:
Friend --
At midnight tonight we reach our first fundraising deadline of 2015.
First thing tomorrow morning, Wednesday, April 1, I will be sitting down with the national campaign committee to set our budget and strategy for the next three months.
I WANT TO HAVE SOME FANTASTIC NEWS FOR THE TEAM -- BUT I NEED YOUR SUPPORT.
DONATE $ RIGHT NOW (THAT’S AFTER THE TAX CREDIT) AND YOU WILL PUSH US OVER THE TOP. [1]
Your donation today will allow us to double our effort in target ridings, and send more Green MPs to Ottawa in 2015.
WE HAVE THE OPPORTUNITY TO SMASH OUR TARGET OF $140 000, SO DONATE NOW -- WE ONLY HAVE A FEW HOURS LEFT.
Here's the link: GREENPARTY.CA/STRONGEST-QUARTER-EVER [1]
Thanks,
Paul
[1]
PAUL NOBLE DEPUTY NATIONAL CAMPAIGN MANAGER GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
P.S. I KNOW WE'VE SENT A LOT OF EMAIL, BUT THIS IS JUST SUCH A CRITICAL DEADLINE FOR THE GPC. THE 2015 ELECTION COULD BE THE ONE THAT CHANGES EVERYTHING. HELP US MAKE THAT A REALITY WITH A CONTRIBUTION OF $ OR MORE RIGHT NOW. [1]
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

from.name: Emily McMillan, Green Party of Canada

message.subject: 1 down 2 to go
message.text:
Friend --
A month ago we asked the other three party leaders a simple yes or no question.
DO YOU WANT ELIZABETH MAY IN THE LEADERS’ DEBATE IN 2015?
Over 60 000 Canadians have signed on to raise the pressure, and this week it paid off -- Justin Trudeau answered the question, and he said yes.
However, Thomas Mulcair and Stephen Harper still haven't provided a straight answer.
Which raises a new question. What are they afraid of?
A RECENT POLL SHOWED 70% OF CANADIANS WANT ELIZABETH MAY IN THE LEADERS’ DEBATE.
The election is only a few months away, which means time is running out for Mr. Mulcair and Mr. Harper to stand up for democracy.
ADD YOUR NAME TODAY AND DEMAND THAT THEY JOIN THE VAST MAJORITY OF CANADIANS WHO WANT ELIZABETH IN THE DEBATES. [1]
Here's the link: WWW.GREENPARTY.CA/STAND-UP-FOR-DEMOCRACY [1]
Thanks, Emily
[1]
Emily McMillan Executive Director Green Party of Canada
[2] [3]
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

from.name: Emily McMillan, Green Party of Canada

message.subject: green light
message.text:
Friend --
NOW THIS IS WHAT MOMENTUM LOOKS LIKE.
One month ago, I wasn't sure what was going to happen with the leaders' debate. It was clear that the other three parties didn't want us there, and I have to admit, I was nervous we were going to be left out.
THAT IS WHY THIS NEWS IS SO EXCITING -- IT’S BEEN CONFIRMED THAT ELIZABETH MAY WILL BE IN THE DEBATES.
And it's all thanks to you and the 80 000 other Canadians who took the time to sign-on and stand up for democracy.
This is what grassroots democracy looks like, everyday Canadians joining together and demanding better.
BUT WE ARE JUST GETTING STARTED.
GETTING ELIZABETH IN THE DEBATE WAS THE FIRST STEP TOWARDS SUCCESS IN 2015 -- NOW WE NEED YOU TO TAKE THE NEXT STEP. DONATE $ TODAY AND KEEP THE MOMENTUM GOING. [1]
Friend, we are up against three parties with big donors and deep pockets. We rely on grassroots donations from everyday Canadians like you.
DONATE $ TODAY, AND HELP US BUILD ON THIS BIG NEWS, AND KEEP THE MOMENTUM ROLLING. [1]
Together, we can make this the election that changes everything.
Thanks, Emily
[1]
Emily McMillan Executive Director Green Party of Canada
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

from.name: Emily McMillan, Green Party of Canada

message.subject: Harper’s last budget?
message.text:
Friend
Today the Harper Conservatives released their seventh budget, lets make sure it's their last.
Just like the previous six, today's budget fails to put a price on carbon, gives more tax-breaks to the wealthy, and shows a lack of vision by subsidizing the unsustainable industries of the past, instead of investing in jobs ready for the modern economy.
WITH THE ELECTION LESS THAN SIX MONTHS AWAY, I THOUGHT I SHOULD GET YOU EXCITED ABOUT VOTING GREEN IN 2015, BY SHOWING YOU WHAT OUR BUDGET WOULD PRIORITIZE.
A Green budget would:
-- Invest in knowledge and skills-based jobs, and make apprenticeship programs and post-secondary education more accessible and affordable
-- Put Canadian small businesses first, by establishing a green venture capital fund and reducing red tape
-- End subsidies for carbon-intensive industries, GMOs, and nuclear power
STAND WITH THE GREEN PARTY TODAY, SIGN-ON AND SHOW YOUR SUPPORT FOR OUR ECONOMIC VISION. [1]
A vision that focuses on building a jobs economy based on knowledge, skills, and sustainable resource development. A vision that makes sure Canadian-owned small businesses have the ability to compete and thrive. A vision that recognizes a prosperous economy must exist alongside a fair and equitable society.
With the election right around the corner, it is a good time to step back and think about what values matter most to you.
IF FAIRNESS, STABILITY, AND SUSTAINABILITY ARE HIGH ON YOUR BUDGET PRIORITY LIST, SIGN ON TODAY AND SUPPORT THE GREEN PARTY’S BUDGET PLAN. [1]
Together, we can work to build a better more prosperous future for all Canadians.
[1]
Thanks, Emily
Emily McMillan Executive Director Green Party of Canada
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

message.subject: big spenders
message.text:
Friend --
THE ELECTION IS RIGHT AROUND THE CORNER.
The other three parties have already started spending millions of dollars bombarding Canadians with advertisements on TV, radio, and in newspapers coast to coast.
If we want to continue to compete, we need your support before we reach our next fundraising deadline -- 11:59 PM, SUNDAY, MAY 31.
DONATE $ TODAY, SO WE CAN CONTINUE TO SPREAD OUR VISION. [1]
A positive and forward-looking vision, focused on building an economy based on skills, knowledge, and sustainable resource development. A vision focused on establishing a fairer and more accountable government. A vision focused on defending our coastlines, our democracy, our future.
DONATE $ TODAY, WE CAN’T DO THIS WITHOUT YOU. [1]
Thanks,
Dave
DAVE BAGLER CHAIR, NATIONAL CAMPAIGN COMMITTEE GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

from.name: Bruce Hyer, Green Party of Canada

message.subject: small business first
message.text:
Friend,
What is responsible for creating 8-million Canadian jobs, for more than half of all Canadian investment in research and development, and for contributing over $300-billion a year to Canada's economy?
SMALL BUSINESS.
When it comes to small businesses, the numbers are pretty impressive, and that is without even mentioning their environmental leadership.
Small businesses are innovative, flexible, and work side-by-side with other local suppliers and producers - exactly what we need if we are going to shift to an economy based on skills, knowledge and sustainable resource development. Over the last decade -while big businesses have been cutting jobs- the vast majority of new jobs have been created by small businesses.
THAT IS WHY ELIZABETH MAY AND THE GREEN PARTY OF CANADA ARE PUTTING SMALL BUSINESSES FIRST.
SIGN ON TODAY AND SUPPORT ELIZABETH’S PRIVATE MEMBER’S BILL IN THE HOUSE OF COMMONS, WHICH WILL ENSURE THE FEDERAL GOVERNMENT WILL HAVE TO CONSIDER THE IMPACT OF THEIR POLICIES ON SMALL BUSINESSES BEFORE THEY CAN PASS ANY NEW BUSINESS REGULATIONS. [1]
CANADA HAS THE POTENTIAL TO CAPITALIZE ON THE SINGLE BIGGEST BUSINESS OPPORTUNITY IN HUMAN HISTORY – THE SHIFT TO A GREEN ECONOMY.
If we are serious about leading that transition, we have to make sure small businesses are supported as the central driver of our economy.
That is exactly what Elizabeth is doing with her "Think Small First" legislation, which will protect local Canadian businesses that are environmental visionaries and important job creators.
SIGN-ON AND SHOW YOUR SUPPORT FOR OUR VISION, WHICH WILL CREATE A CANADIAN ECONOMY WHERE SUSTAINABLE SMALL BUSINESSES CAN NOT ONLY COMPETE, BUT THRIVE:
GREENPARTY.CA/SMALL-BUSINESS-FIRST [1]
Thanks,
Bruce
BRUCE HYER DEPUTY LEADER GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
[2] [3]
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

message.subject: not this again
message.text:
Friend --
I can't believe that we have to talk about this again.
I KNOW THAT YOU AND I AGREE -- WHEN THERE’S A LEADERS’ DEBATE THIS ELECTION, ELIZABETH MAY NEEDS TO BE THERE.
That's pretty simple.
But now that Stephen Harper has decided to skip the National Broadcasters' debate -- the one Elizabeth has been invited to, and over 14-million Canadians watched in 2011 -- it looks like there could be up to five more debates during this election period.
ELIZABETH AND THE GREEN PARTY HAVE NOT BEEN INCLUDED IN‎ MOST OF THEM.
In March, we asked Canadians to stand up for democracy and ask Stephen Harper, Thomas Mulcair, and Justin Trudeau whether they wanted to see Elizabeth in the leaders' debate.
Friend, it was the support of 70 000 Canadians who signed a petition like this one that pressured Mr. Trudeau into publicly stating that Elizabeth should be included in the debates.
We already know that Stephen Harper doesn't want Elizabeth there.
So we need you to put the pressure on another leader: Mr. Mulcair.
ADD YOUR NAME TODAY -- PUT THE PRESSURE ON MR. MULCAIR TO ANSWER THE QUESTION ONCE AND FOR ALL. DO YOU WANT TO SEE ELIZABETH MAY IN ALL DEBATES: YES OR NO? [1]
CANADIANS DESERVE TO KNOW WHERE THE PARTY LEADERS STAND ON THIS ISSUE. MR. MULCAIR HAS CONTINUED TO DODGE THE QUESTION, LET’S CHANGE THAT:
WWW.GREENPARTY.CA/YES-OR-NO [1]
Thank you for all of your support,
Julian
JULIAN MORELLI DIRECTOR OF COMMUNICATIONS GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
[2] [3]
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

from.name: Bruce Hyer, Green Party of Canada

message.subject: my friend's birthday
message.text:
Friend --
You might not know this, but Elizabeth May's birthday is only 3 days away, and we wanted to surprise her with a pretty special birthday card.
I WANTED TO MAKE SURE YOU GOT THE CHANCE TO SIGN YOUR NAME AND LEAVE HER A BRIEF MESSAGE OF SUPPORT:
GREENPARTY.CA/BIRTHDAY-CARD [1]
Thanks, she's going to love this.
Bruce
BRUCE HYER DEPUTY LEADER GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
[2] [3]
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

from.name: Emily McMillan, Green Party of Canada

message.subject: something is happening...
message.text:
, SOMETHING IS HAPPENING HERE.
Donations are skyrocketing, with small individual donations pouring in from our grassroots supporters all over the country.
WE HAVE NOW SET GREEN PARTY FUNDRAISING RECORDS SIX QUARTERS IN A ROW.
What about membership numbers? You guessed it, they are up too -- over 20% since the beginning of the year.
Elected Green representatives -- Canadians now have them everywhere from Vancouver to Fredericton, Thunder Bay to Victoria, and as of last month, Prince Edward Island.
SOMETHING IS HAPPENING HERE -- GREEN CANDIDATES ARE STARTING TO WIN!
JUNE 30TH IS A CRITICAL FUNDRAISING DEADLINE, HELP US MAKE OUR SECOND QUARTER FUNDRAISING GOAL OF $750,000 BY DONATING $ TODAY. [1]
2015 will be the year we break through. Keep the momentum going by donating $5 today.
GREENPARTY.CA/DONATE [1]
Thanks,
Emily
EMILY MCMILLAN EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

message.subject: it’s worth defending
message.text:
Friend --
Our coastlines, our drinking water, our national parks -- we love these things, and defending them is no easy task, especially in the era of the Harper Conservatives.
The current government has been giving away our natural resources to foreign multinational corporations at an alarming rate, and has pushed for the reckless and unsustainable expansion of the oilsands and other high-polluting industries.
BUT I HAVE GOOD NEWS FOR YOU.
An election is right around the corner, and that means we can replace Conservative MPs with Green MPs.
THAT IS EXACTLY WHAT WE WILL DO -- BUT WE NEED YOUR HELP.
All across the country we have principled, respected, and well-known candidates going head-to-head with Conservative incumbents.
BY DONATING $ TODAY YOU WILL ENSURE GREEN CANDIDATES HAVE THE RESOURCES THEY NEED TO WIN (IT ONLY COSTS AFTER THE TAX CREDIT). [1]
11:59PM TUESDAY, JUNE 30 -- THIS IS OUR MOST IMPORTANT FUNDRAISING DEADLINE TO DATE.
CHIP IN $ BEFORE THE DEADLINE TO HELP US ELECT GREEN MPS IN 2015. [1]
[1]
Thanks,
Dave
DAVE BAGLER PRESIDENT GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

from.name: Craig Cantin, Green Party of Canada

message.subject: pending
message.text:
Friend --
The other three parties are already spending millions of dollars bombarding Canadians with attack ads.
We need your help to ensure our positive vision doesn't get drowned out by their negative advertisements.
Here's the election year supporter record we have for this exact email address:
-- DEADLINE: June 30, 11:59 pm
-- SUPPORTER EMAIL: greennod@mikesmit.com
-- ELECTION YEAR DONOR: *Pending*
-- DONATION NEEDED FROM: your riding
-- SUGGESTED ACTION TODAY: MAKE YOUR 2015 ELECTION DONATION AHEAD OF TUESDAY’S MIDNIGHT DEADLINE [1]
Help spread our positive vision of a strong and sustainable Canada.
DONATE $ TODAY (THAT’S ONLY AFTER THE TAX CREDIT) -- THIS DEADLINE IS CRITICAL.
GREENPARTY.CA/DONATE [1]
Thanks,
Craig
CRAIG CANTIN DEPUTY EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR GREEN PARTY OF CANADA

message.subject: step up
message.text:
Thanks to the hard work of thousands of grassroots supporters like you, we have come so far in the last four years -- lets keep the momentum going.
Friend, I am asking you to step up today by donating $5.
Our deadline is 11:59 pm tomorrow -- help us reach our fundraising goal so we can elect more Green MPs to join me in Ottawa in 2015.
DONATE $ TODAY, AND LET’S MAKE THE 2015 ELECTION THE ONE THAT CHANGES CANADIAN POLITICS FOR GOOD:
GREENPARTY.CA/DONATE [1]
Thanks,
Elizabeth
Elizabeth May Leader Green Party of Canada
Green Party of Canada PO Box 997, STN B, Ottawa ON, K1P 5R1 1.866.868.3447
This email was sent to: greennod@mikesmit.com (unsubscribe [2] | opt-out [3])
Authorized by the Green Party of Canada Fund, Chief Agent for the Green Party of Canada.

message.subject: DEADLINE: only a couple hours left
message.text:
Friend --
ONLY A FEW HOURS LEFT.
July and August -- these are the months that will determine how we do in the election. Most people wait until the election is called to make a donation, but we need your support right now!
AT MIDNIGHT TONIGHT WE CLOSE THE BOOKS ON THE SECOND QUARTER -- THIS IS AN ABSOLUTELY CRITICAL FUNDRAISING DEADLINE.
We are already working hard in our target ridings, where we know Green candidates can win in 2015. If we hit our fundraising target of $750,000 by midnight tonight, we will be able to double our effort in those ridings -- hiring more staff, training more volunteers, increasing our advertising reach.
Thousands of grassroots supporters across Canada have already pitched in to get us to $723,855 -- we are so close to our target.
YOU CAN PUSH US OVER THE TOP BY DONATING $ RIGHT NOW (IT ONLY COSTS AFTER THE TAX CREDIT). [1]
If we want real change to come to Ottawa following the 2015 election, we need to elect more Green MPs.
THIS IS THE YEAR WE BREAKTHROUGH -- DONATE $ TODAY AND HELP US START THE SUMMER OFF RIGHT.
GREENPARTY.CA/DONATE [1]
Thanks,
Paul
PAUL NOBLE DEPUTY NATIONAL CAMPAIGN MANAGER GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------
This email was sent to: greennod@mikesmit.com

message.subject: this is the end
message.text:
Friend --
WE HAVE A PLAN TO END POVERTY.
It's called the Guaranteed Livable Income (GLI), and today Elizabeth May joined me in Fredericton to announce the Green Party plan to end poverty in Canada once and for all.
IF YOU AGREE THAT IT IS TIME TO MAKE POVERTY HISTORY, THEN ADD YOUR NAME TODAY. [1]
Tackling poverty in Canada will take bold action. Our plan will ensure no Canadian's income falls below what is necessary for health, life, and dignity.
The GLI provides reassurance for families struggling to make ends meet, a vital helping hand for stay-at-home parents, stability for the thousands of Canadians who can only find part-time work, and much needed support for those looking to complete their education and launch a successful career.
Our plan would greatly reduce the burden on our emergency and social services, saving our system money, and empowering all citizens to overcome periods of hardship.
Together, we can end poverty in Canada.
IF YOU WANT TO BE PART OF THIS WORK, START WITH SOMETHING SIMPLE -- SAY THAT YOU SUPPORT THE GUARANTEED LIVABLE INCOME TODAY:
GREENPARTY.CA/END-POVERTY [1]
Thanks for your support,
Mary Lou
MARY LOU BABINEAU CANDIDATE, FREDERICTON GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
[2] [3]
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

message.subject: it just isn’t healthy
message.text:
Friend --
NO CANADIAN SHOULD EVER STRUGGLE TO MAKE ENDS MEET JUST BECAUSE OF THEIR HEALTH.
This idea inspired Canadians to work together and build a public health care system that, at one time, was the envy of the world.
However, our current system is broken -- it doesn't provide coverage for the critical prescription medications that so many Canadians rely upon day in, day out.
THAT IS WHY THIS ELECTION, THE GREEN PARTY OF CANADA IS TAKING ACTION. TODAY, I JOINED ELIZABETH MAY IN VICTORIA TO ANNOUNCE OUR PLAN TO EXPAND PUBLIC HEALTH COVERAGE TO INCLUDE PRESCRIPTION MEDICATION. [1]
The math is simple. Canadians are four times more likely not to fill their prescriptions if they have to pay out of pocket, which just isn't healthy.
Meanwhile, our per capita spending on prescriptions is more than double what people in other countries pay in their public systems, which just doesn't make economic sense.
By switching to a system where a central bulk-buying agency purchases prescription medication, Canadians would save upwards of $10 billion a year. In addition to the cost savings, we will apply greater rigour to drug registration, ensuring all prescription medication is safe for you and your family.
Our plan will create a truly universal health care system, which will finally ensure no Canadian ever has to face a financial crisis because of their health needs.
WE CAN MAKE THIS PLAN A REALITY -- ALL IT TAKES IS YOUR SUPPORT.
SIGN-ON TODAY, AND SAY THAT YOU SUPPORT THE GREEN PARTY’S VISION FOR TRULY UNIVERSAL HEALTH CARE. [1]
Together, we can ensure no Canadian has to lose sleep worrying about whether they or their family will have to choose between their health, or putting food on the table.
Lets work together to ensure Canadian families get the health coverage they deserve.
SIGN-ON TODAY, AND SHOW YOUR SUPPORT FOR A BETTER HEALTH CARE SYSTEM. [1]
Thanks,
Frances
FRANCES LITMAN CANDIDATE, ESQUIMALT–SAANICH–SOOKE GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
[2] [3]

message.subject: rumours
message.text:
Friend --
The rumour in Ottawa is that Stephen Harper is going to call the election tomorrow.
That is 42 days earlier than expected.
WHY NOW?
Simple. Stephen Harper wants this to be the most expensive election in Canadian history.
Thanks to a new rule he introduced, Harper's early election call would allow the Conservative Party to spend an extra $20 million beyond the normal campaign spending limits.
THAT MEANS WE HAVE TO SPEND MORE THAN WE ORIGINALLY PLANNED -- HELP US BY DONATING $ TODAY. [1]
When Elizabeth May beat a sitting Conservative cabinet minister in the riding of Saanich--Gulf Islands in 2011, most pundits said he couldn't be beat. Elizabeth and her grassroots campaign proved that good ideas, positive vision, and a whole lot of hard work beats the broken status quo every time.
SURE, WE DON’T HAVE DEEP POCKETS LIKE THE OTHER PARTIES, BUT WE HAVE SOMETHING SO MUCH BETTER.
We have grassroots supporters from coast to coast to coast, who chip in with a donation or a couple hours of volunteering whenever they can -- all in an effort to build a sustainable and prosperous future for all Canadians.
Help make sure we don't get drowned out by the other parties' big spending.
CHIP IN $ RIGHT NOW – WE ARE RELYING ON GRASSROOTS SUPPORTERS LIKE YOU:
SECURE.GREENPARTY.CA/DONATE [1]
Thanks,
Craig
CRAIG CANTIN DEPUTY EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

from.name: Emily McMillan, Green Party of Canada

message.subject: here we go!
message.text:
Friend --
THIS IS IT!
I am sure you have heard, but in case you missed it, here is the news -- THE 2015 ELECTION HAS BEEN CALLED!
We have achieved so much since Elizabeth May became the first elected Green MP in Canadian history. If we want to expand that legacy and send more Greens to join Elizabeth in Ottawa to fight for a sustainable and prosperous future for all Canadians, we need everyone to step up.
START BY DONATING $ TODAY. [1]
If preparing for an election is a marathon -- this is the homestretch.
LET'S FINISH STRONG: http://www.greenparty.ca/sites/all/modules/civicrm/extern/url.ph p?u=124924&qid=32529125 [1]
Thanks,
Emily
EMILY MCMILLAN EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

message.subject: did you see this?
message.text:
Friend --
Yesterday, at 6:30 in the morning, I joined hundreds of Green Party supporters to watch Elizabeth May launch our campaign.
Why did we all get up so early on a Sunday morning on a holiday weekend? Because we are ready to build a Canada that works. Together.
IT WAS PRETTY EXCITING -- CHECK IT OUT YOURSELF: [1]
[1]
[2] [3]
Thanks,
Rita
RITA FROMHOLT WEST COAST CAMPAIGN COORDINATOR GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
[2] [3]

message.subject: I’m asking,
message.text:
Friend,
Thanks to the hard work of thousands of grassroots supporters like you, we have come so far in the last four years -- keep the momentum going.
THE ELECTION HAS STARTED, I AM ASKING YOU TO STEP UP TODAY BY DONATING $. [1]
Our first fundraising deadline of the election period is only a couple days away -- pitch in now so we can elect more Green MPs to join me in Ottawa.
DONATE $ TODAY, AND LET’S MAKE THE 2015 ELECTION THE ONE THAT CHANGES CANADIAN POLITICS FOR GOOD:
secure.greenparty.ca/donate [1]
Thanks,
Elizabeth
Elizabeth May Leader Green Party of Canada
Green Party of Canada PO Box 997, STN B, Ottawa ON, K1P 5R1 1.866.868.3447
This email was sent to: greennod@mikesmit.com (unsubscribe [2] | opt-out [3])
Authorized by the Green Party of Canada Fund, Chief Agent for the Green Party of Canada.

message.subject: only once
message.text:
Friend --
You only get one opportunity to start off a campaign strong -- we can't let this moment pass us by.
OUR FIRST CRITICAL FUNDRAISING DEADLINE OF THIS ELECTION IS TOMORROW AT 11:59 PM.
Here is the support record we have for this exact email address:
-- SUPPORTER EMAIL: greennod@mikesmit.com*
-- ELECTION PERIOD DONOR: *Pending*
-- DONATION NEEDED FROM: your riding
-- SUGGESTED ACTION TODAY: MAKE YOUR 2015 ELECTION DONATION OF $ BEFORE IT IS TOO LATE [1]
>From purchasing lawn signs to funding television and radio advertisements, your support is absolutely essential to our success -- every donation moves us closer to winning seats.
WE CAN’T DO THIS WITHOUT YOU.
[1]
Thanks,
Kyle
KYLE TATE DIGITAL DIRECTOR GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
* If you have made a recent contribution thank you so much for your support, it may take our system a few days to process.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

message.subject: up for debate
message.text:
Friend --
It is already here.
Tonight at 8pm ET/5pm PT Elizabeth May will stand side-by-side with the other major party leaders in the first debate of the 2015 election.
THIS MAY BE THE ONLY TIME ELIZABETH WILL GO HEAD-TO-HEAD WITH STEPHEN HARPER IN A DEBATE.
>From job creation to the environment, Elizabeth will draw a stark contrast between our innovative and pragmatic solutions, and the status quo policies that the other parties offer.
, BEFORE ELIZABETH TAKES THE STAGE TONIGHT, WE NEED EVERYONE TO ADD THEIR NAME TO SHOW HER THEIR SUPPORT. [1]
SHOW YOUR SUPPORT NOW [1] and then be sure to tune in tonight and watch Elizabeth in action.
Here are the details:
WHAT: First Leaders' Debate of the 2015 Election WHEN: Thursday, August 6 at 8pm ET/5pm PT Where to Watch:
TELEVISION: Omni TV, CPAC and CityTV ----- ONLINE: http://www.greenparty.ca/sites/all/modules/civicrm/extern/url.php?u=125001&qi d=33330992 [2]
Thanks,
Julian
JULIAN MORELLI DIRECTOR OF COMMUNICATIONS GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
[3] [4]
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

message.subject: before Elizabeth takes the stage
message.text:
Friend --
In just a couple of hours, Elizabeth May will participate in the first leaders' debate of the election.
Before she takes the stage, I want to have some good news for her. I want to be able to tell her we are going to exceed our goal for our first fundraising deadline of the election.
THE DEADLINE IS TONIGHT AT 11:59 PM.
DONATE $ NOW, AND MAKE SURE IT IS NOTHING BUT GOOD NEWS GOING INTO TONIGHT'S DEBATE. [1]
[1]
Thanks,
Lorna
LORNA MUNGUR FUNDRAISING COORDINATOR GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

message.subject: who won the debate?
message.text:
Friend --
Who won the debate last night?
It was clearly Elizabeth May, she was precise, engaging, and intelligent. But let's face it, I am a bit biased -- so don't take my word for it, take theirs:
“GREEN LEADER ELIZABETH MAY STEALS THE SPOTLIGHT IN LEADERS’ DEBATE.” - Huffington Post
“ELIZABETH MAY ADDED FRESH PERSPECTIVES AND PROVED SHE BELONGS IN THESE DEBATES. THERE IS NO REASON TO EXCLUDE HER.” - Andrew Coyne Editor, National Post
“MAY DELIVERED AN OUTSTANDING PERFORMANCE.” - Michael Den Tandt Political Columnist, Postmedia
“IN A DIRECT SENSE, GREEN PARTY LEADER ELIZABETH MAY IS WINNING TONIGHT.” - The Guardian
The other party leaders are trying to block Elizabeth from participating in all the debates. Indeed, as it stands right now, this is the last time Elizabeth will go head-to-head with Stephen Harper and Thomas Mulcair.
SIGN-ON TODAY AND DEMAND THAT ELIZABETH MAY AND THE GREEN PARTY BE INCLUDED IN ALL THE DEBATES. [1]
Elizabeth's performance last night sent a clear message -- she belongs at every debate.
MAKE THAT HAPPEN, SIGN-ON AND DEMAND THAT ELIZABETH BE INVITED TO ALL THE DEBATES.
Here is the link: GREENPARTY.CA/INVITE-ELIZABETH [1]
Thanks,
Paul
PAUL NOBLE DEPUTY NATIONAL CAMPAIGN MANAGER GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
[2] [3]

from.name: Craig Cantin, Green Party of Canada

message.subject: not the issue:
message.text:
Friend -
THIS WEEK, THERE IS NO DOUBT WHICH STORY WILL BE GRABBING ALL THE HEADLINES.
Today, Stephen Harper's former chief of staff will take the stand to testify during Mike Duffy's trial on charges of fraud, breach of trust, and bribery.
The other parties will use this opportunity to sling mud and land low blows, but we have a different plan.
Instead of letting this sideshow distract from major issues, we are going to continue focusing on what Canadians like you care about most.
FROM JOB CREATION TO INFRASTRUCTURE SPENDING, THE ENVIRONMENT TO SENIORS CARE -- WE WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD A CANADA THAT WORKS, TOGETHER.
WE NEED YOUR HELP TO SPREAD THAT VISION -- DONATE $ TODAY. [1]
The Green Party is committed to transparent, accountable and representative government. That is why Elizabeth May was the first MP to publish all her expenses online -- a lead that all Green Party MPs will follow.
DONATE $ TODAY, AND HELP CHANGE CANADIAN POLITICS FOR GOOD.
[1]
Thanks,
Craig
CRAIG CANTIN DEPUTY EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

from.name: Paul Manly, Green Party of Canada

message.subject: not how it used to be
message.text:
Friend --
THIS IS NOT HOW IT USED TO BE.
We once recognized the immense contribution of veterans by granting them security in the form of a lifetime pension. After a decade of mismanagement and over $266-million in cuts, our veterans no longer have that guarantee, and have even had to fight the current government in court for the benefits they deserve.
THIS IS NOT HOW IT SHOULD BE.
Worldwide, Canada was recognized as a nation that was first to defend human rights, first to commit to poverty alleviation, and first to contribute to peacekeeping missions. Now, our government is increasingly being known for aggression and arrogance instead of careful diplomacy.
THIS IS NOT HOW IT HAS TO BE.
The Green Party is committed to restoring Canada's global role as a leader in peacekeeping and poverty alleviation, and ensuring that the women and men who risk everything to serve our country have access to the benefits they deserve.
That is why yesterday I joined Elizabeth May in Nanaimo to announce our policy on veterans and security. Outlining our plan to recommit to the United Nations, and create a new Veteran's Charter that will guarantee those who serve our nation have access to the best care and benefits.
SIGN-ON TODAY AND SUPPORT OUR PLAN. [1]
[1]
Thanks,
Paul
PAUL MANLY CANDIDATE, NANAIMO—LADYSMITH GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
[2] [3]

from.name: Emily McMillan, Green Party of Canada

message.subject: here are the facts
message.text:
Friend --
Only 190 permanent jobs will be created by the Energy East pipeline.
THAT IS IT, 190.
Is that worth the risk?
Assessments of Energy East have called it a "looming catastrophe." It will put our sources of fresh drinking water at risk, and will devastate already dwindling populations of beluga whales in the St. Lawrence. In New Brunswick, oil tanker traffic would more than double - from the fishing industry to tourism, the economic impact of a spill would be catastrophic.
THOSE ARE THE FACTS, AND HERE IS ANOTHER: THE GREEN PARTY OF CANADA IS THE ONLY NATIONAL PARTY THAT HAS TAKEN A STANCE IN OPPOSITION TO THE ENERGY EAST PIPELINE.
Instead of supporting high-risk, low-reward projects like Energy East, we are putting forward policies that will propel our economy forward.
Our plan will provide tax breaks for sustainable local businesses, create thousands of jobs by investing in retrofitting our buildings to higher standards of energy efficiency, and provide incentives for companies to invest in sustainable energy.
IT IS TIME. SIGN-ON TODAY TO SAY NO TO RISKY PIPELINE SCHEMES AND INCREASED TANKER TRAFFIC. [1]
[1]
It is time to build a Canada that works, together.
Emily
Emily McMillan Executive Director Green Party of Canada
[2] [3]
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

from.name: Craig Cantin, Green Party of Canada

message.subject: risky pipelines?
message.text:
Friend --
THE KINDER MORGAN TRANS-MOUNTAIN PIPELINE EXPANSION JUST ISN’T WORTH THE RISK.
A leak would cost our economy billions of dollars in lost revenue -- from the fishing industry to tourism, the economic impact would be catastrophic.
Not to mention the damage it would do to the water we drink, the air we breath, and the land that sustains us -- all would be put at risk because of the short-term thinking that is driving this project.
In April, we saw the damage a so-called "small spill" did to Vancouver's harbour. The Kinder Morgan pipeline would lead to a sevenfold increase in tanker traffic in that same harbour. It just doesn't make sense to support this project, yet the other parties continue to do just that.
THERE’S ONLY ONE RIGHT ANSWER ON KINDER MORGAN: NO.
The Green Party is the only party that has taken a clear stance in opposition to this pipeline.
DONATE $ TODAY**, AND SUPPORT OUR EFFORTS TO SEND MORE GREEN MPS TO OTTAWA TO DEFEND OUR COASTLINE. [1]
Together, we can build a more sustainable and prosperous economy -- that starts by transitioning away from the high-polluting and high-risk industries of the past.
NO LEADER COULD POSSIBLY MOVE FORWARD WITH KINDER MORGAN TRANS-MOUNTAIN IF THEY’RE SERIOUS ABOUT BUILDING A BETTER FUTURE FOR ALL CANADIANS.
Green MPs in Ottawa will make sure that never happens:
[1]
Thanks for your support,
Craig
CRAIG CANTIN DEPUTY EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
** THAT’S ONLY AFTER THE TAX CREDIT -- MAKE A CONTRIBUTION TODAY! [1]
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

message.subject: in 7 days
message.text:
Friend,
NEXT WEEK MARKS THE END OF THE FIRST MONTH OF THIS CAMPAIGN -- IT ALSO MARKS A CRITICAL DEADLINE FOR OUR TEAM.
First thing Tuesday morning, we will sit down and establish our advertising budget for September.
We have great ideas about how to spread our vision for Canada, but as it stands, we might not have the money to follow through with them.
Thanks to Stephen Harper's decision to double the length of this election, we have had to double our spending. That was his plan all along -- to gain an unfair advantage by making this the most expensive election in Canadian history.
THAT IS WHY I AM ASKING FOR YOUR SUPPORT -- DONATE $ TODAY AND HELP US GET OUR FIRST AD ON TV. [1]
We need to increase our media presence, but whether we can do that depends on the budget I am able to present to my team on Tuesday.
YOUR CONTRIBUTION IS CRITICAL -- DONATE TODAY. [1]
Thanks,
Paul
[1]
Paul Noble Deputy National Campaign Manager Green Party of Canada
WANT TO DONATE BY PHONE? CALL TOLL-FREE: 1-866-868-3447 7 AM - MIDNIGHT ET IF YOU HAVE TROUBLE GETTING THROUGH, PLEASE TRY AGAIN!

message.subject: halfway to history
message.text:
Friend --
We have until midnight on Monday, August 31, to make Green Party history.
TO DO THAT, WE NEED TO RAISE $250,000 BY THE DEADLINE. IT IS AN AMBITIOUS TARGET, BUT WE ARE ON PACE TO DO IT -- ALL WE NEED NOW IS YOUR SUPPORT. [1]
During this election period, we have seen our strongest fundraising results ever. But if we want to win seats on election day, we need to keep pushing.
THIS DEADLINE IS CRITICAL.
Tuesday morning, our campaign committee will sit down and plan out our first television advertisement of the election.
THAT IS WHY I AM ASKING YOU TO DONATE $ TODAY. [1]
The more Canadians who see our ad, the more Canadians who will vote Green on election day -- it is that simple.
With your support, we can ensure Canadians from coast to coast see our new ad.
NOW IS THE TIME TO DONATE $ -- WE ONLY HAVE A FEW DAYS LEFT. [1]
[1]
Thanks,
Julian
Julian Morelli Director of Communications Green Party of Canada
WANT TO DONATE BY PHONE? CALL TOLL-FREE: 1-866-868-3447 7 AM - MIDNIGHT ET IF YOU HAVE TROUBLE GETTING THROUGH, PLEASE TRY AGAIN!

from.name: Emily McMillan, Green Party of Canada

message.subject: did you see this?
message.text:
Friend --
We are four weeks into the 2015 election, and the mudslinging and name-calling has reached record highs.
Attack ads may be what the other parties are doing, but that just isn't our style. That is why our new commercial is going to focus on our plans to solve today's challenges, not yesterday's political grudges.
WE NEED YOUR HELP TO GET OUR FIRST POSITIVE CAMPAIGN AD ON TV -- DONATE TODAY. [1]
Our ads are going to talk about the issues Canadians like you care about -- like our plan to create thousands of new jobs and cut energy bills for thousands of Canadian families by modernizing all of Canada's buildings to a higher standard of energy efficiency.
WE HAVE A PLAN TO GROW CANADA’S ECONOMY WHILE DEFENDING OUR ENVIRONMENT AND BUILDING A FAIRER SOCIETY -- BUT GOOD IDEAS ALONE DON’T WIN ELECTIONS.
People need to hear about our plan, that is why getting this commercial on air is so critical.
Our budget meeting IN FIVE DAYS is where we will decide whether we have the money to press play on this new commercial, that is why it is so important that you donate today.
DONATE $ TODAY: SECURE.GREENPARTY.CA/DONATE. [1]
Thanks,
Emily
[1]
EMILY MCMILLAN EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
WANT TO DONATE BY PHONE? CALL TOLL-FREE: 1-866-868-3447 7 AM - MIDNIGHT ET IF YOU HAVE TROUBLE GETTING THROUGH, PLEASE TRY AGAIN!

message.subject: lol
message.text:
Friend --
Have you seen the Conservatives' newest attack ad? It would be funny if it weren't so outrageous.
OUR FIRST COMMERCIAL IS GOING TO BE NOTHING LIKE IT -- OURS WILL BE POSITIVE, OPTIMISTIC, AND ISSUE-BASED.
IF THAT SOUNDS LIKE A POLITICAL COMMERCIAL YOU WOULD ACTUALLY WANT TO SEE ON TV, DONATE TODAY AND HELP US GET IT ON AIR. [1]
We can change the channel on attack ads -- starting by flooding the airwaves with our positive message.
ON SEPTEMBER 1, WE WILL SET OUR AD BUDGET FOR THE NEXT MONTH OF THE CAMPAIGN.
DONATE $ TODAY TO MAKE SURE OUR NEW AD GETS THE GO AHEAD. [1]
[1]
Thanks for your support,
Kyle
Kyle Tate Digital Director Green Party of Canada
WANT TO DONATE BY PHONE? CALL TOLL-FREE: 1-866-868-3447 7 AM - MIDNIGHT ET IF YOU HAVE TROUBLE GETTING THROUGH, PLEASE TRY AGAIN!
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

from.name: Craig Cantin, Green Party of Canada

message.subject: URGENT DEADLINE
message.text:
Friend --
With your support, we can ensure Canadians from coast to coast see our new positive campaign ad.
Our next budget meeting is TUESDAY MORNING, which means we are RUNNING OUT OF TIME to hit our fundraising target and ensure we can get our new commercial on air.
HERE’S THE ELECTION PERIOD SUPPORTER RECORD WE HAVE FOR THIS EXACT EMAIL ADDRESS:
SUPPORTER EMAIL: greennod@mikesmit.com
ELECTION PERIOD DONOR: Pending**
DONATION NEEDED FOR: Commercial #1
SUGGESTED ACTION TODAY: DONATE $ AHEAD OF MONDAY’S MIDNIGHT DEADLINE [1]
Every dollar raised is another Canadian who will see our new ad -- another potential Green voter who will be convinced to cast their ballot for a better, more sustainable future.
[1]
Thanks,
Craig
Craig Cantin Deputy Executive Director Green Party of Canada
**If you recently donated and it is not reflected in this record, don't worry, with so much support pouring in we may be a day or two behind in processing your donation. Thanks for your support.
WANT TO DONATE BY PHONE? CALL TOLL-FREE: 1-866-868-3447 7 AM - MIDNIGHT ET IF YOU HAVE TROUBLE GETTING THROUGH, PLEASE TRY AGAIN!
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

message.subject: in less than 12 hours:
message.text:
Dear Friend,
With less than 12 hours until our fundraising deadline, I wanted to send you a quick note to let you know how we are doing.
Thanks to the amazing generosity of supporters like you, we have already raised $230,000 this week, meaning we only need to raise $20,000 more to hit our target.
THIS DEADLINE IS CRITICAL -- HOW MUCH WE RAISE BY MIDNIGHT ON MONDAY WILL DETERMINE HOW MUCH WE CAN SPEND SPREADING OUR POSITIVE MESSAGE ON TV, RADIO AND IN PRINT MEDIA FROM COAST-TO-COAST.
Our campaign teams have hit the ground running in target ridings across the country, working to ensure more Green MPs will join me in Ottawa after this election.
Donate today to ensure we have the funds we need to press play on our new commercials, and help lay the groundwork for unprecedented success on election day.
PLEASE DONATE $ TODAY -- WE HAVE LESS THAN 12 HOURS LEFT BEFORE THE DEADLINE. [1]
Thanks,
Elizabeth

from.name: Craig Cantin, Green Party of Canada

message.text:
Friend --
On Wednesday, Elizabeth will be in Vancouver to mark an important date, the halfway point of the election.
That's right, we are only halfway through this election. Stephen Harper called this extra-long election because he wanted it to be the most expensive in Canadian history. He thought he could win simply by outspending his opponents.
WHAT HE DIDN’T COUNT ON WAS GRASSROOTS SUPPORTERS.
Green Party supporters all across the country have been volunteering, putting up signs in their front yards, and pledging to vote Green on October 19th. We are doing extremely well but if we want to turn momentum into wins, we have to step it up another notch.
Our National Campaign Manager has given us an ambitious target - in the NEXT 48 HOURS, we have to sign-up 1,000 NEW VOLUNTEERS, process 5,000 NEW SIGN REQUESTS, and ensure 25,000 MORE CANADIANS PLEDGE TO VOTE GREEN ON OCTOBER 19TH.
Those are big numbers and to reach them will be a challenge, but I know our team is up to it. We just need your help.
HELP US REACH OUR GOAL BY TAKING ONE, TWO, OR ALL THREE OF THESE ACTIONS TODAY:
TAKE A SIGN [1]
JOIN OUR TEAM – VOLUNTEER [2]
PLEDGE TO VOTE GREEN ON OCTOBER 19TH [3]
Thanks, we can't do this without you.
Craig
CRAIG CANTIN DEPUTY EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

from.name: Craig Cantin, Green Party of Canada

message.subject: re: tomorrow’s deadline
message.text:
Friend,
Tomorrow, Elizabeth will be in Vancouver to mark the halfway point of the campaign by making a major announcement.
Our National Campaign Manager has set some benchmarks that we have to meet before tomorrow's event:
-- SIGN-UP 1,000 NEW VOLUNTEERS -- PROCESS 5,000 SIGN REQUESTS -- ENSURE 25,000 MORE CANADIANS PLEDGE TO VOTE GREEN.
We are on our way to hitting those targets, but I need your help.
TAKE A SIGN [1]
JOIN OUR TEAM – VOLUNTEER [2]
PLEDGE TO VOTE GREEN ON OCTOBER 19TH [3]
With the support of Canadians like you, we will be celebrating Green victories on election day.
Thanks again,
Craig
CRAIG CANTIN DEPUTY EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

from.name: Emily McMillan, Green Party of Canada

message.subject: Our Platform
message.text:
Friend,
Just minutes ago, Elizabeth May introduced the Green Party Platform for 2015.
It is the product of hard work and input by Canadians from coast to coast, and lays out a plan to get our country back on the right track.
>From building strong communities, to making housing more affordable, to abolishing tuition fees for college, university and skills training programs, to creating thousands of good, local jobs - IT IS A PLAN TO MOVE CANADA FORWARD [1].
CHECK IT OUT FOR YOURSELF. [1]
We need to make sure potential voters all across the country see our platform, so make sure to share it far and wide.
[2] [3]
Here is the link to the platform: GREENPARTY.CA/PLATFORM [1]
Thanks for your support,
Emily
Emily McMillan Executive Director Green Party of Canada
[2] [3]
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

message.subject: re: Our Platform
message.text:
Friend --
Yesterday, we released the Green Party Election Platform.
It's our fully costed plan to get our country back on the right track.
In it, you'll find clear commitments to build a Canada that works, together.
CHECK IT OUT FOR YOURSELF. [1]
Let me share just three commitments with you. We will:
-- Invest in our future by abolishing tuition for university, college and skills training programs, and slashing student debt for students and their families.
-- Unleash an army of carpenters, electricians and contractors to modernize outdated buildings and plug the leaks that increase greenhouse gases and energy bills.
-- Introduce a National Pharmacare Plan, saving Canadian taxpayers over $10 billion a year and ensuring prescription medication is available to all Canadians regardless of their income.
Electing Green MPs starts with sharing our vision with voters.
TELL YOUR FRIENDS ABOUT OUR PLATFORM.
Here is the link:GREENPARTY.CA/PLATFORM [1]
[2] [3]
Thanks for your support,
Paul
PAUL NOBLE DEPUTY NATIONAL CAMPAIGN MANAGER GREEN PARTY OF CANADA
[2] [3]
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

message.subject: still can’t believe this
message.text:
Friend --
The Globe and Mail is hosting a leaders' debate on Thursday. Over 80% of Canadians say they want Elizabeth May and the Green Party to participate, but The Globe and Mail has decided to exclude her anyway.
HOW ANTI-DEMOCRATIC IS THAT?
We knew we were never going to raise as much money as the other three parties, but we did think our ideas -- our vision for Canada -- would be given equal footing.
THE GLOBE AND MAIL DEBATE THIS WEEK IS WORTH MORE THAN $200,000 OF FREE AIR TIME TO THE OTHER THREE PARTIES.
So our fundraising team has set an ambitious goal: RAISE $200,000 BY THE TIME THE DEBATE STARTS [1].
With your generous donation, we will purchase local ads all across the country and make up the ground we will lose Thursday night.
These ads will help spread our positive message, and make sure that Canadians from St. John's to Victoria know about our plan to move Canada forward.
HELP US SPREAD OUR MESSAGE, DONATE $ TODAY. [1]
[1]
Thanks,
Kyle
Kyle Tate Digital Director Green Party of Canada
WANT TO DONATE BY PHONE? CALL TOLL-FREE: 1-866-868-3447 7 AM - MIDNIGHT ET IF YOU HAVE TROUBLE GETTING THROUGH, PLEASE TRY AGAIN!

from.name: Craig Cantin, Green Party of Canada

message.subject: lost ground
message.text:
Friend --
National leaders' debates are supposed to be about democracy, giving Canadians the opportunity to compare and contrast party leaders and their platforms.
No party with seats in the House of Commons has ever been kept out of debates before and yet the Globe and Mail has decided arbitrarily to exclude Elizabeth May and the Green Party from this Thursday's debate -- it is just plain anti-democratic.
WE NEED TO RAISE $200,000 BY THURSDAY TO MAKE UP THE GROUND WE WILL LOSE WHILE THE OTHER THREE PARTIES ARE GETTING ALL THAT FREE AIR TIME DURING THE DEBATE. [1]
Every dollar we raise between now and Thursday will be put toward buying local ads in battleground ridings all across the country. Ridings where we know we can win on October 19th.
CONTRIBUTE $ TODAY. [1]
[1]
Thanks,
Craig
Craig Cantin Deputy Executive Director Green Party of Canada
WANT TO DONATE BY PHONE? CALL TOLL-FREE: 1-866-868-3447 7 AM - MIDNIGHT ET IF YOU HAVE TROUBLE GETTING THROUGH, PLEASE TRY AGAIN!

from.name: Emily McMillan, Green Party of Canada

message.subject: how does this make you feel?
message.text:
Friend --
Elizabeth May and the Green Party will be excluded from Thursday's leaders' debate, but that is probably what Stephen Harper had in mind when he hand-picked the Globe and Mail to host it.
TELL THE GLOBE WHAT YOU THINK ABOUT THEIR DECISION TO INTERFERE WITH THE DEMOCRATIC PROCESS BY ARBITRARILY EXCLUDING ELIZABETH MAY.
FILL OUT OUR ONLINE FORM AND ADD A PERSONAL MESSAGE TO BE EMAILED TO PHILLIP CRAWLEY, PUBLISHER AND CEO OF THE GLOBE AND MAIL. [1]
Polls show that over 80% of Canadians want Elizabeth May to be included in all the national leaders' debates. The Globe and Mail didn't get that message - make sure they get yours.
Tell them how you feel: GREENPARTY.CA/TELL-THEM-HOW-YOU-FEEL [1]
Thanks,
Emily
Emily McMillan Executive Director Green Party of Canada
[2] [3]
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------

from.name: Craig Cantin, Green Party of Canada

message.subject: relieve debt, abolish tuition
message.text:
Friend,
I know firsthand what it is like to face crushing student debt.
As a father, hardly a day goes by where I don't think about how I can ensure that my daughters don't face the same burden that I did when I was a student and young adult.
THAT IS WHY I AM SO PROUD AND EXCITED BY THE GREEN PARTY’S PLEDGE TO ABOLISH TUITION FEES FOR COLLEGE, UNIVERSITY AND SKILLS-TRAINING PROGRAMS.
Last week, as part of our fully-costed election platform, we laid out a plan to ensure that students and their families will no longer have to worry about the prospect of graduating with mountains of debt.
As our plan is being phased in, we will invest in the success of current students, jumpstart the Canadian economy, and give our graduates a hand-up by implementing a debt relief program.
Whether you are a contractor looking to perfect your trade, a recent university graduate burdened by student debt, or -- like me -- the parent of young teens just a few years away from going off to school, our plan will help you.
SIGN-ON TODAY TO SUPPORT ELIZABETH MAY AND THE GREEN PARTY’S PLAN TO ABOLISH TUITION FEES AND ELIMINATE STUDENT DEBT. [1]
In a country as wealthy as Canada it is unacceptable that qualified students can miss out on the education they deserve just because they aren't able to afford tuition.
WE CAN DO BETTER THAN OUR CURRENT SYSTEM. [1]
ADD YOUR NAME IN SUPPORT OF THE GREEN PARTY PLAN TODAY.
[1]
Thanks,
Craig
Craig Cantin Executive Deputy Director Green Party of Canada
[2] [3]

from.name: Emily McMillan, Green Party of Canada

message.subject: last chance to let them know
message.text:
--
The Globe and Mail decided arbitrarily to exclude Elizabeth May from tonight's leaders' debate.
No party with seats in the House of Commons has ever been excluded from the leaders' debates before.
Let the people who made that decision know what you think about their choice.
FILL OUT OUR ONLINE FORM AND ADD A PERSONAL MESSAGE TO BE EMAILED TO PHILLIP CRAWLEY, PUBLISHER AND CEO OF THE GLOBE AND MAIL. [1]
Polls show that over 80% of Canadians want Elizabeth May to be included in all the national leaders' debates. The Globe and Mail didn't get that message - make sure they get yours.
Tell them how you feel: GREENPARTY.CA/TELL-THEM-HOW-YOU-FEEL [1]
Thanks,
Emily
Emily McMillan Executive Director Green Party of Canada
[2] [3]
